options.content: Started class on time and materials were ready and reminded pupils of expectations (at least one expectation reviewed)
Started late > 1 minute after the bell or start time and / or some materials were not ready and / or did not remind pupils of expectation(s)
No opening or spent >40% on opening
All material was necessary and practice was sufficient
Some material was missing, practice was insufficient or excessive
Activities engaged all pupils for all problems / tasks; response opportunities clearly directed
Activities engaged some pupils for some problems / tasks
Activities did not engage most pupils for most problems / tasks

rows.tooltip:
4 Criteria of Good Monitoring
1. Check all pupils' work
2. Provided feedback
3. Made a data based decision (Y / N)
4. Provided re-teaching as appropriate

options.content: May include objective, link, and appropriate relevance

rows.tooltip:
1. Appropriate material (pupils knew prerequisites
2. Teachable Chunk, got through NM, GP, and IP
3. Made data based decisions to progress through new material and guided practice

1. Clear steps / appropriate sequence within tasks
2. Prompted known steps / decisions & modeled (taught) new
3. Asked why questions to determine deeper understanding

1. Has detailed and simplified script in lesson plan
2. Follows NM and GP lesson plan unless pupil responses demonstrate a need to deviate
3. Problems aligned to instructional target
4. Sufficient problems (including problems and answers in lesson plan or specified page number of text for where to find problems and answers)

1. Teacher and pupil did together - if in pairs / groups, work is clearly directed and teacher feedback provided
2. Responses were oral and written and clearly directed; individual and group responses incorporated
3. Numerous opportunities for students to practice are incorporated
4. Continued to probe for deeper understanding, "why" questions included
5. Guided practice format / activities and problems aligned with lesson plan

options.content: Did not meet any criteria or only met 1 criteria

rows.tooltip:
1. Prompts / questions reduced & faded so pupils are prepared to do problems independent
2. Peer supports are used (Pair / Group work) and are gradually faded
3. Level of difficulty gradually increases
4. Students provided with tools that meet level of need and are gradually reduced (ex: written out strategy, concrete manipulatives, calculators, etc.)

4 Criteria of Good Monitoring
1. Check all pupils' work
2. Provided feedback
3. Made a data based decision (Y / N)
4. Provided re-teaching as appropriate

options.content: 4 or more response opportunities per minute
Less than two response opportunities per minute
Spent 30-70% of time on NM / GP
Spent <30% or >70% of time on NM / GP
Description of assignment included, completion time and follow-up (WA)
Description of assignment included completion time, but there was no follow-up

IP Problems were aligned to GP; varied problems and / or maintenance problems provided (included problems and answers in lesson plan or specified page numbers of text for where to find problems and answers)
IP Problems were appropriate, no problem variety or maintenance problems provided
IP problems were inappropriate, and no problem variety or maintenance problems provided

rows.tooltip:
4 Criteria of Good Monitoring
1. Check all pupils' work
2. Provided feedback
3. Made a data based decision (Y / N)
4. Provided re-teaching as appropriate

options.content: Spent 20-30% of time on IP for the majority of pupils
Spent 30-50% or 10-20% of time on IP for the majority of pupils
Spent >50% or <10% of time on IP for the majority of pupils
80% or more of praise is appropriate
Less than 80% of praise is appropriate

rows.tooltip:
4 Components of Quality Praise
1. Varied
2. Contingent
3. Descriptive
4. Non-disruptive

options.content: Praise / redirect ratio at least 4:1; praise rate appropriate for group / individual
Praise / redirect ratio of at least 2:1
Corrects all pupil errors. Follows each correction with independent correct response
Corrects some pupil errors. Follows some with independent correction response

rows.tooltip:
Good Feedback Criteria
1. Feedback arises naturally from pupil work
2. Feedback motivates pupil to persevere

options.content: Student follows classroom management plan with positive consequences and follows plan for problem behavior
Student sometimes follows classroom management plan or is inconsistent in following plan for problem behaviors
Student does not follow behavior management plan

tooltip: Refer to USU Department of Special Education and Rehabilitation Professional Guidelines

rows.tooltip:
1. Dresses modestly in clean clothes in good repair
2. Dresses consistent with the dress of teachers and administrators in the school
3. Maintains good personal hygiene

options.content: Dresses appropriately and maintains good personal hygiene
Does not dress appropriately and / or does not maintain personal hygiene

rows.tooltip:
1. Accepts feedback
2. Acknowledges need for improvement,
3. Asks questions for clarification,
4. Immediately implements recommended changes

options.content: Does not respond appropriately to feedback

rows.tooltip:
1. Implements changes in behavior, procedure, or schedule as recommended
2. Checks with person who provided feedback to receive input on whether implementation is correct

options.content: Correctly implements changes after being given feedback
Does not correctly implement changes after being given feedback

rows.tooltip:
Exhibits appropriate verbal and nonverbal communication
(i.e., tone of voice, facial expression, gestures, etc.)
when interacting with teachers, classroom staff, and students.

options.content: Exhibits positive and respectful attitude in the classroom
Does not exhibit positive and respectful attitude in the classroom

rows.tooltip:
Effective team member, appropriate levels of independence, constructive verbal messages,
listen to and understands feedback, self / social awareness, self / relationship management,
accepts responsibility, self-control, expresses self appropriately, generalized information

options.content: Demonstrates many or all professional attributes
Does not demonstrate or only sometimes demonstrates professional attributes
